name.title: Plugin Name
name.description: This name will be displayed in the Homebridge log.

email.title: Email
email.description: It is recommended to set up a separate account for Homebridge and share the devices from your main account.

exposeOutdoorUnit.title: Expose Outdoor Unit
exposeOutdoorUnit.description: When enabled, the plugin will create a separate accessory for your outdoor unit which will display the (outdoor) temperature it measures. This can be used for monitoring and automation purposes.

debugMode.title: Debug Mode
debugMode.description: When enabled, debug messages will be written to the log.

suppressOutgoingUpdates.title: Suppress outgoing device updates
suppressOutgoingUpdates.description: When enabled, changes in the Home app will not be sent to Comfort Cloud. Useful for testing your installation without constantly switching the state of your AC to minimise wear and tear.

appVersionOverride.title: Emulated Comfort Cloud app version (override)
appVersionOverride.description: The plugin will automatically fetch the latest version number from the App Store. If that fails, it will use the last known working value which is hard-coded. This setting allows you to override both of these if needed. It should normally reflect the latest version on the App Store.

minHeatingTemperature.title: Minimum heating temperature (override)
minHeatingTemperature.description: The default heating temperature range is 16-30°C. Some Panasonic ACs have an additional heating mode for the range of 8-15°C. If you own such a model, you can use this setting to adjust the minimum value. Leave it empty or undefined to use the default value.
